codeSystems.name: AddressType
codeSystems.title: AddressType
codeSystems.description: The type of an address (physical / postal).

codeSystems.name: AddressUse
codeSystems.title: AddressUse
codeSystems.description: The use of an address.
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-CertDIVOC.html: Certificate - DIVOC Verifiable Credential Logical Model

codeSystems.name: AdministrativeGender
codeSystems.title: AdministrativeGender
codeSystems.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-DDCCCoreDataSet.VS.C: DDCC Core Data Set Logical Model - Vaccination Status - Continuity of Care

codeSystems.name: AllLanguages
codeSystems.title: All Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all possible codes from BCP-47 (see http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTBodyStructures
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Body Structures
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all codes from [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) where concept is-a 442083009 (Anatomical or acquired body site (body structure)).

codeSystems.name: BundleType
codeSystems.title: BundleType
codeSystems.description: Indicates the purpose of a bundle - how it is intended to be used.

codeSystems.name: DocumentTypeValueSet
codeSystems.title: Document Type Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code specifying the precise type of document (e.g. Pulmonary History and  Physical, Discharge Summary, Ultrasound Report, etc.). The Document Type value set includes all LOINC  values listed in HITSP C80 Table 2-144 Document Class Value Set Definition above used for Document Class,  and all LOINC values whose SCALE is DOC in the LOINC database.

codeSystems.name: FacilityTypeCodeValueSet
codeSystems.title: Facility Type Code Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code representing the type of organizational setting where the clinical encounter, service, interaction, or treatment occurred. The value set used for Healthcare Facility Type has been defined by HITSP to be the value set reproduced from HITSP C80 Table 2-147.

codeSystems.name: PracticeSettingCodeValueSet
codeSystems.title: Practice Setting Code Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code representing the clinical specialty of the clinician or provider who interacted with, treated, or provided a service to/for the patient. The value set used for clinical specialty has been limited by HITSP to the value set reproduced from HITSP C80 Table 2-149 Clinical Specialty Value Set Definition.

codeSystems.name: SNOMEDCTClinicalFindings
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT Clinical Findings
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all the "Clinical finding" [SNOMED CT](http://snomed.info/sct) codes - concepts where concept is-a 404684003 (Clinical finding (finding)).

codeSystems.name: CommonTags
codeSystems.title: Common Tags
codeSystems.description: Common Tag Codes defined by FHIR project

codeSystems.name: CompositionAttestationMode
codeSystems.title: CompositionAttestationMode
codeSystems.description: The way in which a person authenticated a composition.

codeSystems.name: CompositionStatus
codeSystems.title: CompositionStatus
codeSystems.description: The workflow/clinical status of the composition.

codeSystems.name: Condition/Problem/DiagnosisCodes
codeSystems.title: Condition/Problem/Diagnosis Codes
codeSystems.description: Example value set for Condition/Problem/Diagnosis codes.

codeSystems.name: ContactEntityType
codeSystems.title: Contact entity type
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the purpose for which you would contact a contact party.

codeSystems.name: DataAbsentReason
codeSystems.title: DataAbsentReason
codeSystems.description: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing.

codeSystems.name: DaysOfWeek
codeSystems.title: DaysOfWeek
codeSystems.description: The days of the week.

codeSystems.name: ProcedureDeviceActionCodes
codeSystems.title: Procedure Device Action Codes
codeSystems.description: Example codes indicating the change that happened to the device during the procedure.  Note that these are in no way complete and might not even be appropriate for some uses.

codeSystems.name: FHIRDeviceTypes
codeSystems.title: FHIR Device Types
codeSystems.description: Codes used to identify medical devices. Includes concepts from SNOMED CT (http://www.snomed.org/) where concept is-a 49062001 (Device)  and is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: DeviceNameType
codeSystems.title: DeviceNameType
codeSystems.description: The type of name the device is referred by.

codeSystems.name: FHIRDeviceStatus
codeSystems.title: FHIRDeviceStatus
codeSystems.description: The availability status of the device.

codeSystems.name: FHIRDeviceStatusReason
codeSystems.title: FHIRDeviceStatusReason
codeSystems.description: The availability status reason of the device.

codeSystems.name: DiagnosticReportStatus
codeSystems.title: DiagnosticReportStatus
codeSystems.description: The status of the diagnostic report.

codeSystems.name: DiagnosticServiceSectionCodes
codeSystems.title: Diagnostic Service Section Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all the codes in HL7 V2 table 0074.

codeSystems.name: DocumentSectionCodes
codeSystems.title: Document Section Codes
codeSystems.description: Document section codes (LOINC codes used in CCDA sections).

codeSystems.name: FHIRDocumentTypeCodes
codeSystems.title: FHIR Document Type Codes
codeSystems.description: FHIR Document Codes - all LOINC codes where scale type = 'DOC'.

codeSystems.name: DocumentClassValueSet
codeSystems.title: Document Class Value Set
codeSystems.description: This is the code specifying the high-level kind of document (e.g. Prescription, Discharge Summary, Report, etc.). Note: Class code for documents comes from LOINC, and is based upon one of the following:The type of service described by the document. It is described at a very high level in Section 7.3 of the LOINC Manual. The type study performed. It was determined by identifying modalities for study reports. The section of the chart where the document is placed. It was determined from the SETs created for Claims Attachment requests.

codeSystems.name: DocumentReferenceStatus
codeSystems.title: DocumentReferenceStatus
codeSystems.description: The status of the document reference.

codeSystems.name: DocumentRelationshipType
codeSystems.title: DocumentRelationshipType
codeSystems.description: The type of relationship between documents.

codeSystems.name: EventStatus
codeSystems.title: EventStatus
codeSystems.description: Codes identifying the lifecycle stage of an event.

codeSystems.name: DocumentReferenceFormatCodeSet
codeSystems.title: DocumentReference Format Code Set
codeSystems.description: The value set is defined to be the set of format codes defined by the IHE Technical Framework, and also including additional format codes defined by the    HL7. The value set is listed in HITSP C80 Table 2-153 Format Code Value Set Definition,    with additions published later by IHE as published    at http://wiki.ihe.net/index.php?title=IHE_Format_Codes   and with additions published later by HL7 as published at https://confluence.hl7.org/display/SD/Format+Codes+for+IHE+XDS.   This is the code specifying the technical format of the document. Along with the typeCode,    it should provide sufficient information to allow any potential document consumer to know    if it will be able to process the document. The code shall be sufficiently specific to    ensure processing/display by identifying a document encoding, structure and template. The actual list of codes here is incomplete

codeSystems.name: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.title: HTTPVerb
codeSystems.description: HTTP verbs (in the HTTP command line). See [HTTP rfc](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231) for details.

codeSystems.name: Identifier Type Codes
codeSystems.title: IdentifierType
codeSystems.description: A coded type for an identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

codeSystems.name: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.title: IdentifierUse
codeSystems.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationFunctionCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Function Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the function a practitioner or organization may play in the immunization event. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationFundingSource
codeSystems.title: Immunization Funding Source
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the source of the vaccine administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationOriginCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Origin Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person, entity or organization who administered the vaccine. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationProgramEligibility
codeSystems.title: Immunization Program Eligibility
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the patient's eligibility for a vaccination program. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationReasonCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Reason Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose of vaccine was administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationRecommendationDateCriterionCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Recommendation Date Criterion Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support the definition of dates relevant to recommendations for future doses of vaccines. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationRecommendationReasonCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Recommendation Reason Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reasons why a given recommendation status is assigned. This value set is provided as a suggestive example and includes SNOMED CT concepts.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationRecommendationStatusCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Recommendation Status Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the status of the patient towards perceived immunity against a vaccine preventable disease. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationStatusCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Status Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the current status of the administered dose of vaccine.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationStatusReasonCodes
codeSystems.title: Immunization Status Reason Codes
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose of vaccine was not administered. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: ImmunizationSubpotentReason
codeSystems.title: Immunization Subpotent Reason
codeSystems.description: The value set to instantiate this attribute should be drawn from a terminologically robust code system that consists of or contains concepts to support describing the reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent. This value set is provided as a suggestive example.

codeSystems.name: Iso3166-1-2
codeSystems.title: Iso 3166 Part 1: 2 Letter Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines the ISO 3166 Part 1 2-letter codes
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-HCertDCC.html: Payload for Certificate - EU DCC CBOR Web Token Logical Model

codeSystems.name: Iso3166-1-3
codeSystems.title: Iso 3166 Part 1: 3 Letter Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines the ISO 3166 Part 1 3-letter codes
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-CertDIVOC.html: Certificate - DIVOC Verifiable Credential Logical Model
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-DDCCCoreDataSet.TR.h: DDCC Core Data Set Logical Model for Test Result
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-CertICAO.html: Certificate - ICAO Visible Digital Seal Logical Model
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-DDCCCountryOfEvent.h: DDCC Country Of Event for Immunization
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-DDCCCoreDataSet.VS.C: DDCC Core Data Set Logical Model - Vaccination Status - Continuity of Care
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-DDCCCoreDataSet.VS.h: DDCC Core Data Set Logical Model for Vaccination Status
codeSystems.StructureDefinition-DDCCCoreDataSet.VS.P: DDCC Core Data Set Logical Model - Vaccination Status - Proof of Vaccination

codeSystems.name: QuestionnaireItemType
codeSystems.title: QuestionnaireItemType
codeSystems.description: Distinguishes groups from questions and display text and indicates data type for questions.

codeSystems.name: Jurisdiction ValueSet
codeSystems.title: Jurisdiction
codeSystems.description:
This value set defines a base set of codes for country, country subdivision and region    for indicating where a resource is intended to be used.   
   
   Note: The codes for countries and country subdivisions are taken from    [ISO 3166](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html)    while the codes for "supra-national" regions are from    [UN Standard country or area codes for statistical use (M49)](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/methods/m49/m49.htm).

codeSystems.name: CommonLanguages
codeSystems.title: Common Languages
codeSystems.description: This value set includes common codes from BCP-47 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47)

codeSystems.name: LinkType
codeSystems.title: LinkType
codeSystems.description: The type of link between this patient resource and another patient resource.

codeSystems.name: ListEmptyReasons
codeSystems.title: List Empty Reasons
codeSystems.description: General reasons for a list to be empty. Reasons are either related to a summary list (i.e. problem or medication list) or to a workflow related list (i.e. consultation list).

codeSystems.name: PatientMedicineChangeTypes
codeSystems.title: Patient Medicine Change Types
codeSystems.description: Example Item Flags for the List Resource. In this case, these are the kind of flags that would be used on a medication list at the end of a consultation.

codeSystems.name: ListMode
codeSystems.title: ListMode
codeSystems.description: The processing mode that applies to this list.

codeSystems.name: ListOrderCodes
codeSystems.title: List Order Codes
codeSystems.description: Base values for the order of the items in a list resource.

codeSystems.name: ListStatus
codeSystems.title: ListStatus
codeSystems.description: The current state of the list.

codeSystems.name: Marital Status Codes
codeSystems.title: MaritalStatus
codeSystems.description: This value set defines the set of codes that can be used to indicate the marital status of a person.

codeSystems.name: Mime Types
codeSystems.title: MimeType
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all possible codes from BCP-13 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp13)

codeSystems.name: NameUse
codeSystems.title: NameUse
codeSystems.description: The use of a human name.

codeSystems.name: ObservationCategoryCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Category Codes
codeSystems.description: Observation Category codes.

codeSystems.name: LOINCCodes
codeSystems.title: LOINC Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set includes all LOINC codes

codeSystems.name: ObservationInterpretationCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Interpretation Codes
codeSystems.description:
A categorical assessment, providing a rough qualitative interpretation of the observation value,    such as “normal”/ “abnormal”,”low” / “high”, “better” / “worse”, “susceptible” / “resistant”, “expected”/ “not expected”.    The value set is intended to be for ANY use where coded representation of an interpretation is needed.   
   
   Notes:
   
   This is being communicated in v2.x in OBX-8 (Observation Interpretation), in v3 in ObservationInterpretation (CWE) in R1 (Representative Realm) and in FHIR in    Observation.interpretation. Historically these values come from the laboratory domain, and these codes are extensively    used. The value set binding is extensible, so codes outside the value set that are needed for interpretation concepts    (i.e. particular meanings) that are not included in the value set can be used, and these new codes may also be added to    the value set and published in a future version.

codeSystems.name: ObservationStatus
codeSystems.title: ObservationStatus
codeSystems.description: Codes providing the status of an observation.

codeSystems.name: OrganizationType
codeSystems.title: Organization type
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate a type of organization.

codeSystems.name: ProcedurePerformerRoleCodes
codeSystems.title: Procedure Performer Role Codes
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines the set of codes that can be used to indicate a role of a procedure performer.

codeSystems.name: PractitionerRole
codeSystems.title: Practitioner role
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the role of a Practitioner.

codeSystems.name: ProcedureCategoryCodes(SNOMEDCT)
codeSystems.title: Procedure Category Codes (SNOMED CT)
codeSystems.description: Procedure Category code: A selection of relevant SNOMED CT codes.

codeSystems.name: ProcedureFollowUpCodes(SNOMEDCT)
codeSystems.title: Procedure Follow up Codes (SNOMED CT)
codeSystems.description: Procedure follow up codes: A selection of SNOMED CT codes relevant to procedure follow up.

codeSystems.name: ProcedureNotPerformedReason(SNOMED-CT)
codeSystems.title: Procedure Not Performed Reason (SNOMED-CT)
codeSystems.description: Situation codes describing the reason that a procedure, which might otherwise be expected, was not performed, or a procedure that was started and was not completed. Consists of SNOMED CT codes, children of procedure contraindicated (183932001), procedure discontinued (416406003), procedure not done (416237000), procedure not indicated (428119001), procedure not offered (416064006), procedure not wanted (416432009), procedure refused (183944003), and procedure stopped (394908001).

codeSystems.name: ProcedureOutcomeCodes(SNOMEDCT)
codeSystems.title: Procedure Outcome Codes (SNOMED CT)
codeSystems.description: Procedure Outcome code: A selection of relevant SNOMED CT codes.

codeSystems.name: ProcedureReasonCodes
codeSystems.title: Procedure Reason Codes
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines the set of codes that can be used to indicate a reason for a procedure.

codeSystems.name: PublicationStatus
codeSystems.title: PublicationStatus
codeSystems.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

codeSystems.name: QuestionnaireAnswerCodes
codeSystems.title: Questionnaire Answer Codes
codeSystems.description: Example list of codes for answers to questions. (Not complete or necessarily appropriate.)

codeSystems.name: QuestionnaireResponseStatus
codeSystems.title: QuestionnaireResponseStatus
codeSystems.description: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire response.

codeSystems.name: EnableWhenBehavior
codeSystems.title: EnableWhenBehavior
codeSystems.description: Controls how multiple enableWhen values are interpreted -  whether all or any must be true.

codeSystems.name: QuestionnaireItemOperator
codeSystems.title: QuestionnaireItemOperator
codeSystems.description: The criteria by which a question is enabled.

codeSystems.name: QuestionnaireQuestionCodes
codeSystems.title: Questionnaire Question Codes
codeSystems.description: Example list of codes for questions and groups of questions. (Not necessarily complete or appropriate.)

codeSystems.name: ObservationReferenceRangeAppliesToCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Reference Range Applies To Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the particular target population the reference range applies to.

codeSystems.name: ObservationReferenceRangeMeaningCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the meaning/use of a reference range for a particular target population.

codeSystems.name: ResourceType
codeSystems.title: Resource Types
codeSystems.description: Concrete FHIR Resource Types

codeSystems.name: ResourceType
codeSystems.title: ResourceType
codeSystems.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

codeSystems.name: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.title: SearchEntryMode
codeSystems.description: Why an entry is in the result set - whether it's included as a match or because of an _include requirement, or to convey information or warning information about the search process.

codeSystems.name: All Security Labels
codeSystems.title: SecurityLabels
codeSystems.description: A single value set for all security labels defined by FHIR.

codeSystems.name: FHIRSpecimenCollectionMethod
codeSystems.title: FHIR Specimen Collection Method
codeSystems.description: This example value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the method by which a specimen was collected.

codeSystems.name: SpecimenContainerType
codeSystems.title: Specimen Container Type
codeSystems.description: Checks on the patient prior specimen collection. All SNOMED CT concepts descendants of 706041008 |Device for body fluid and tissue collection/transfer/processing (physical object)|

codeSystems.name: SpecimenProcessingProcedure
codeSystems.title: Specimen processing procedure
codeSystems.description: The technique that is used to perform the process or preserve the specimen.

codeSystems.name: SpecimenStatus
codeSystems.title: SpecimenStatus
codeSystems.description: Codes providing the status/availability of a specimen.

codeSystems.name: UDIEntryType
codeSystems.title: UDIEntryType
codeSystems.description: Codes to identify how UDI data was entered.

codeSystems.name: VaccineAdministeredValueSet
codeSystems.title: Vaccine Administered Value Set
codeSystems.description: This identifies the vaccine substance administered - CVX codes.

codeSystems.name: AbsentOrUnknownImmunizationUvIps
codeSystems.title: Absent or Unknown Immunization - IPS
codeSystems.description: Absent or Unknown Immunization

codeSystems.name: BodySiteUvIps
codeSystems.title: Body Site - IPS
codeSystems.description: IPS body site value set. This value set includes a set of codes from SNOMED CT that may be used to represent body sites (e.g., for laboratory specimen collection).

codeSystems.name: MedicineRouteOfAdministrationUvIps
codeSystems.title: Medicine Route of Administration - IPS
codeSystems.description:
EDQM (European Directorate for the Quality of Medicines and Healthcare) Route of Administration codes.  This Value Set includes all the EDQM Standard Terms having:  
[Concept Status] = ‘Current’ AND  
[Concept Class] = 'ROA' AND  
[Domain] = 'Human and Veterinary'  

ROA = 'Route of administration'

codeSystems.name: PersonalRelationshipUvIps
codeSystems.title: Personal Relationship - IPS [Deprecated]
codeSystems.description: The Value Set is used (optionally) to code the type of contact relationship between a person and the patient. This value set has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release.  It has been replaced with [PersonalRelationshipRoleType](https://terminology.hl7.org/3.1.0/ValueSet-v3-PersonalRelationshipRoleType.html)

codeSystems.name: ProceduresSnomedAbsentUnknownUvIps
codeSystems.title: Procedures - SNOMED CT + Absent/Unknown - IPS
codeSystems.description: This value set includes codes from SNOMED Clinical Terms®: descendants of 71388002 \|Procedure (procedure)\|, excluding [all subtypes of 14734007 \|Administrative procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 59524001 \|Blood bank procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 389067005 \|Community health procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 442006003 \|Determination of information related to transfusion (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 225288009 \|Environmental care procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 308335008 \|Patient encounter procedure (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 710135002 \|Promotion (procedure)\|, all subtypes of 389084004 \|Staff related procedure (procedure)\|], plus IPS codes for absent/unknown procedures.

codeSystems.name: ResultsCodedValuesLaboratoryUvIps
codeSystems.title: Results Coded Values Laboratory - IPS
codeSystems.description: This value set is defined as the union of: (a) Blood group [Type]; (b) Presence/Absence Indicators (2.16.840.1.113883.11.22.52) (c) Microorganisms (2.16.840.1.113883.11.22.49)

codeSystems.name: ResultsLaboratoryObservationUvIps
codeSystems.title: Results Laboratory Observation - IPS
codeSystems.description: Value Set Definition: LOINC {STATUS in {ACTIVE}, CLASSTYPE in {1}, CLASS exclude {CHALSKIN, H&P.HX.LAB, LABORDERS, NR STATS, PATH, PATH.\*, MOLPATH, MOLPATH.\*, CYTO, HL7.CYTOGEN, HL7.GENETICS}}

codeSystems.name: TargetSiteUvIps
codeSystems.title: Target Site - IPS
codeSystems.description: This value set includes codes from SNOMED Clinical Terms®: all descendants of 442083009 | Anatomical or acquired body structure (body structure)|.

codeSystems.name: VaccineTargetDiseasesUvIpsDeprecated
codeSystems.title: Vaccine Target Diseases - IPS [Deprecated]
codeSystems.description: This value set includes the codes from SNOMED CT describing Vaccine Target Diseases. To follow a consistent value set naming pattern, this value set has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release.  It has been replaced with [target-diseases-uv-ips](./ValueSet-target-diseases-uv-ips.html)

codeSystems.name: VaccinesUvIps
codeSystems.title: Vaccines - IPS
codeSystems.description: This value set provides a list of types of vaccine, plus IPS codes for absent/unknown immunizations. It includes codes from SNOMED Clinical Terms®: all descendants of 787859002 \|Vaccine product (product)\|.

codeSystems.name: WhoAtcUvIps
codeSystems.title: WHO ATC - IPS
codeSystems.description: World Health Organization Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) classification system.  Note: The currently implemented code system and the value set expansion contain only a set of example ATC codes, not the complete code system content.

codeSystems.name: IHE_FormatCode_vs
codeSystems.title: IHE ValueSet of Format Codes for use with Document Sharing
codeSystems.description: The IHE FormatCode Value set is defined to be the set of FormatCode(s) defined by IHE, DICOM and HL7. These codes are intended to be preferred.

codeSystems.title: DDCC Composition Category Codes

codeSystems.description: DDCC Designation Types ValueSet for DDCC Folders.

codeSystems.name: DDCC_QR_Format_ValueSet
codeSystems.title: DDCC QR Format Codes
codeSystems.description: Format of the representation of QR code

codeSystems.name: DDCC_QR_Type_ValueSet
codeSystems.title: DDCC QR Type Codes
codeSystems.description: Type of QR codes by their business usage

codeSystems.name: DIVOC_ValueSet
codeSystems.title: COVID-19 Vaccine Codes for DIVOC
codeSystems.description: COVID-19 Vaccine codes for DIVOC so the FHIR server can perform expansions.

codeSystems.name: ICAOV1_ValueSet
codeSystems.title: DDCC Codes for ICAO Vaccines
codeSystems.description: ICAO vaccines codes for DDCC so the FHIR server can perform expansions.

codeSystems.name: LabTestPathogenCovid19SnomedValueSet
codeSystems.title: Lab Test - Pathogen - COVID-19 - SNOMED CT
codeSystems.description: This is a one-time snapshot of the allowed values for pathogens in EUDCC, retrieved in February 2023 from https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=uriserv%3AOJ.L_.2021.230.01.0032.01.ENG. Contents may need to be updated and readers should consult the credential's documentation.

codeSystems.name: LabTestPathogenDivocValueSet
codeSystems.title: Lab Test - Pathogen - DIVOC

Contents may need to be updated and readers should consult the credential's documentation. Some information on DIVOC's test certificate can be found at https://github.com/egovernments/DIVOC/blob/main/test-certificate-context/test-certificate-context.js. Additional information on DIVOC can be found at <https://divoc.digit.org/platform/divocs-verifiable-certificate-features>

Contents may need to be updated and readers should consult the credential's documentation. Some information on DIVOC's test certificate can be found at https://github.com/egovernments/DIVOC/blob/main/test-certificate-context/test-certificate-context.js. Additional information on DIVOC can be found at <https://divoc.digit.org/platform/divocs-verifiable-certificate-features>

codeSystems.name: Hl7VSAdditivePreservative
codeSystems.title: hl7VS-additivePreservative
codeSystems.description: Concepts specifying any additive introduced to the specimen before or at the time of collection.  These additives may be introduced in order to preserve, maintain or enhance the particular nature or component of the specimen.  Used in Version 2 messaging in the SPM segment.

codeSystems.name: Hl7VSSpecimenCondition
codeSystems.title: hl7VS-specimenCondition
codeSystems.description: Concepts of modes or states of being that describe the nature of a specimen.  Used in Version 2 messaging in the SPM segment.

codeSystems.name: Hl7VSRelevantClincialInformation
codeSystems.title: hl7VS-relevantClincialInformation
codeSystems.description: Value Set of codes that specify additional clinical information about the patient or specimen to report the supporting and/or suspected diagnosis and clinical findings on requests for interpreted diagnostic studies.

codeSystems.name: v2.0360.2.7
codeSystems.title: v2 table 0360, Version 2.7
codeSystems.description: FHIR Value set/code system definition for HL7 v2 table 0360 ver 2.9 ( Degree/License/Certificate)

codeSystems.name: ActCode
codeSystems.title: v3 Code System ActCode
codeSystems.description:
A code specifying the particular kind of Act that the Act-instance represents within its class.  Constraints:
The kind of Act (e.g. physical examination, serum potassium, inpatient encounter, charge financial transaction, etc.) is specified with a code from one of several, typically external, coding systems.  The coding system will depend on the class of Act, such as LOINC for observations, etc. Conceptually, the Act.code must be a specialization of the Act.classCode. This is why the structure of ActClass domain should be reflected in the superstructure of the ActCode domain and then individual codes or externally referenced vocabularies subordinated under these domains that reflect the ActClass structure. Act.classCode and Act.code are not modifiers of each other but the Act.code concept should really imply the Act.classCode concept. For a negative example, it is not appropriate to use an Act.code "potassium" together with and Act.classCode for "laboratory observation" to somehow mean "potassium laboratory observation" and then use the same Act.code for "potassium" together with Act.classCode for "medication" to mean "substitution of potassium". This mutually modifying use of Act.code and Act.classCode is not permitted.

codeSystems.name: v3.ConfidentialityClassification
codeSystems.title: V3 Value SetConfidentialityClassification
codeSystems.description: Set of codes used to value Act.Confidentiality and Role.Confidentiality attribute in accordance with the definition for concept domain "Confidentiality".

codeSystems.title: MHD DocumentReference status codes

codeSystems.name: MHDprovidePatientActions
